frameworks.name: React
frameworks.description: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It allows you to create reusable UI components and provides efficient rendering and state management.

frameworks.name: Angular
frameworks.description: Angular is a TypeScript-based open-source framework for building web applications. It provides a powerful set of features for developing complex, scalable, and maintainable applications.

frameworks.name: Vue.js
frameworks.description: Vue.js is a progressive JavaScript framework for building user interfaces. It focuses on the view layer and offers simplicity, flexibility, and great performance.

frameworks.name: Ember.js
frameworks.description: Ember.js is a JavaScript framework for building ambitious web applications. It provides conventions and best practices to help developers create scalable and maintainable code.

frameworks.name: Backbone.js
frameworks.description: Backbone.js is a lightweight JavaScript library for building client-side applications. It provides a simple and organized structure for models, views, and collections.
